name: Array.prototype.size()
description: ## Implement Array.prototype.size() - _without_ .length ! Implement `Array.prototype.size()`, which should simply return the length of the array. But do it entirely without using `Array.prototype.length`! Where `.length` is a property, `.size()` is a method. ## Rules Because it is quite impossible to disable `[].length`, and because filtering for `"length"` is an iffy proposition at best, THIS KATA WORKS ON THE HONOUR SYSTEM. You may cheat. But you may have trouble sleeping. Or `$DEITY` may kill a puppy. You need not support sparse arrays (but you may!). All testing will be done with dense arrays. Values will not be `undefined`. You need only support actual, real arrays. Your method needs to be read only. Arguments must be ignored. The `this` object must not be modified. Be creative!
